subject: Productivity
title: Getting Things Done
description: A 60-second lesson on Getting Things Done.

hook.text: David Allen's book GTD became a cult classic. Its core idea: get tasks out of your head.

buildup.text: Allen argued that mental clutter kills productivity. Writing everything down frees the mind to focus.

discovery.text: GTD uses five steps: capture, clarify, organize, reflect, and engage. Simplicity drives the system.

twist.text: Critics say GTD is great for task management but weak on prioritization. It captures everything equally.

climax.text: Despite debate, GTD remains one of the most influential productivity systems of the 21st century.

punchline.text: Empty your head. Fill your system.

quiz.question: What is the core idea behind Getting Things Done?
options: Get tasks out of your head and into a system
